page.title: 15Badlesmere : Communications
page.content: Most homes have a telephone installed. There are two public call boxes, at the junction of the A25l with the Throwley road at Leaveland, and on Badlesmere Lees. It is an irritation that the Canterbury telephone area has recently been divided and the boundary now runs through the area. Frequently a local number is in the other directory which is supplied only on request to British Telecom at Canterbury. There are post boxes at the end of Millens Row, Leaveland, at Fisher Street and in the wall of the Badlesmere Stores. There is a twice daily postal delivery, except Sundays, to all houses.
